reviews.review_msg: To future students: I took SA257 in spring 2019. Theres no word in the world to describe this course. We formed a resistant group (around 30 students) and started emailing the chair. We weren't taken seriously until a couple students brought the issues to the dean. Jorge was eventually banned from teaching in the SA department. You can do it too!
I had so many breakdowns because of this class. Never in my life did I have a prof this unorganized and unprepared. AVOID THIS PROF. Some people are just not meant to teach.

Probably the worst class I've ever had the misfortune to take. His lectures and assignments make no sense and are so disorganized. He often inserts terms in these assignments that he's never covered and makes it out to be that we just haven't paid attention in class. I think I understand less about stats now than I did before I took this class.
You will never know what he is talking about in lecture. No good resources used for studying. Releases assignments 4 days before it is due.

Unless you feel like being completely infuriated, stressed, and helpless for an entire semester, stay away. Jorge is unorganized, frequently changes due dates, and is overall just incredibly unapproachable. No lecture slides and his lectures jump around so much it is almost impossible to know what he is talking about.
The worst professor I have ever encountered. You don't understand. Stay away.

Honestly the worst class I have ever taken. Completely refused to answer questions because after one (very confusing) lecture should be enough to understand really difficult material. He is all over the place and has no structure in his lectures at all. The whole class is worried about failing for his lack of teaching, just happy to have a good TA.

No tags fit this prof. Jorge has difficulty explaining course material, is often all over the place in lectures (which I'm pretty sure are not prepared in advance). Exams, good luck. Doesn't provide ample material to ensure success of students in his class or their academic future. Avoid like the plague if able. Sadly, SA257 mandatory.
Do not take a class with this prof. He is a nice guy but cannot teach. This will be the most difficult class you take with no help. You will be teaching yourself the entire course. Avoid if possible.

there are no notes, lectures aren't organized, he's all over the place and is extremely hard to follow. He is not helpful and has this air about him where he really doesn't seem to understand how awful of a teacher he is. I would seriously recommend not taking him. I've learned nothing from him - everything has been from the TA or self-taught.

Very confusing, unable to answer questions about the worksheets he assigns and cannot explain how to do certain questions. Asked him for help and he read the question to me and just walked away. He would explain a concept and half way through realize he taught it wrong, he'd try again and say "I think that's how to do it". DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!

Jorge was extremely difficult to follow. He often came to class not having the materials needed. He gave little to no breaks, and did not have a clear outline for his lectures and tended to jump around all over the place. This course is tough because most students are Arts students and have little experience with SPSS so it was mostly self-taught

I feel attendance is not mandatory but if u miss a class u wouldn't know how to use SPSS. His assignments are very vague and difficult to understand. His midterm is based on SPSS, so memorize that program!! You were allowed to bring in a cheat sheet for the midterm but it didnt help. I also don't recommend emailing him, ask him in person. good luck
